@Followmystyle Or some anal-ysts aren't sufficiently tech-savvy. I don't seee a net decline in demand for high-end linear algebra chips (to put it in somewhat uncommon terms) anytime soon. Crypto is dead but interactive entertainment and AI trainign are not, quite the opposite. 
 
Granted, this year the consumer markets will be in trouble and $NVDA may lull (though I do not expect it to) but that will not last. By the end of the year, most Western economies will have disentangled themselves from the Russian cleptocracy. The US will hugely benefit from new oil and lng contracts, that will spill over to consumer households.

Looks like next Netflix crash will be 
Nvidia 
Nvidia’s gaming cards are increasingly available on major electronics websites, including Microcenter, Newegg, and Amazon. com. Some retailers are showing rising inventory levels and have even started to discount the cards, another clear sign demand is faltering. The weakness is showing up on reseller marketplaces too. According to the price-tracking website CamelCamelCamel, the third-party selling price of an Nvidia RTX 3080 Ti card has fallen roughly 40% this year.
https://www.marketwatch.com/articles/nvidia-stock-chips-demand-supply-outlook-51650492059?siteid=nf-rss

$TSLA = Unethical company. 
Labor abuse. It's like if you want to keep your job? sleep on the floor.  @Therealelonmusk 

Tesla workers at the automaker's facility in Shanghai will be required to sleep on the factory floor as Tesla restarts production after a three-week shutdown, Bloomberg reported on Monday.
Tesla will provide workers with a sleeping bag and mattress and set aside a portion of the factory floor to be used as sleeping accommodations.

Tesla said in the memo that there will also be spaces for showering, food, and entertainment, but the company is still in the process of setting it up, Bloomberg reported. 

https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-shanghai-workers-eat-sleep-factory-floor-avoid-shutdowns-report-2022-4
